intro: Spatulima angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spatulima, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
